intro: Securidaca micheliana, commonly known as the African stranglewood, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and fragrant yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in coastal and sandy soils, and it has a tendency to form dense thickets. Due to its rapid growth and ability to dominate vegetation, it is considered an invasive species in some regions.
